title: Man Utd open talks with Barcelona over Ivan Rakitic transfer
text:
Ivan Rakitic is wanted by Manchester United (Getty Images)

Manchester United have begun talks with Barcelona over a deal for Ivan Rakitic, according to reports in Spain.

The 31-year-old has started just one game this season and has played a total of 186 minutes across six appearances in all competitions.

Barcelona are now open to selling the Croatia international in the January transfer window.

And according to Sport, United have already registered their interest with Barcelona and have opened initial negotiations with the Spanish club.

The report claims that Barca are demanding at least €40 million (£34m) for the midfielder.

Rakitic has barely featured for Barcelona this season (Getty Images)

Inter are ready to rival United in the race to sign Rakitic and have also reportedly made contact with the La Liga champions..

Earlier this week, Rakitic admitted he is unsure over his future at Barcelona and suggestion he would seek a move away if his situation does not improve.

‘It’s tough because I want to play and not just be part of the team,’ he said.

‘I will do everything possible to change my situation.

‘I have two years left on my deal and there’s no better place to play than Barcelona, the best club in the world, but I need to play and not just enjoy walks around the city and by the sea.

‘I spoke with people at the club, everyone knew I had other options.

‘I want to fight so that the team see me ready to deliver on the pitch.

‘I want to thank the fans for the affection they showed me this weekend, but if nothing changes, we will have to sit down and talk about my situation again.’
